column4: Breezy has been running great on my laptop since it was released, but in the past 2 weeks it has been hanging all of the time.
Well, I dual booted to windows and windows runs fine. I also tried swapping the HD into an identical laptop and I get the same hangs
If it's plugged into Ethernet it usually only hangs 4-6 times a day
If it's not plugged into Ethernet it will sometimes hang on boot and will usually only last 5-10 minutes
SMART values are all within thresholds
I've run memtest and it came up clean
On both laptops
Is there any way to do a more thorough HD check than just looking at SMART values?
yea... run badblocks
I think you are barking up the wrong tree.... hard locks are either X lockign up, or something wrong in the kernel... such as a buggy driver... most likely it's X
so if you boot into recovery mode and just let it sit there at the prompt, it will eventually lock up?
yes
any sort of correlation you have noticed?  like it lasts longer after the computer has been off and cold for a while?
and have you tried running memtest86?
let it run for hours?
it's a paperweight if I let it run for hours :)
try disabling the nic then... if the nic driver is buggy, it isn't likely that it would allways lock up in the same point during the boot sequence
huh?  memtest86 can't run for hours and find no problems?
sorry, I thought you meant normal run
no... running memtest86... you need to let it run for several hours to be fairly sure you don't have a ram problem
yank out the card
